key_title: Key to the species of Rosa

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.; Jobson, P.C.
source.title: Rosaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A.; Jobson, P.C. (1996). Rosaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves more or less glabrous except for scattered glands on the midvein below; stipules with glands restricted to margins
Lower surface of leaves with glandular and simple hairs; stipules glandular
Margins of stipules entire, fringed with fine gland-tipped hairs; pedicels more or less glabrous; petals 5
Margins of stipules serrate to subpinnatifid, with dispersed gland-tipped hairs between teeth; pedicels usually with few to many glandular hairs; flowers usually double (with 10 or more petals)
Leaves semi-persistent or persistent; bracts absent; styles protruding, fused in a column
Leaves persistent; bracts present, sometimes falling early; styles shortly protruding, free
